question: What does 'mobility rights' mean?
possible_answers: A. Being able to use any mobile phone service in Canada
B. Being able to live and work anywhere in Canada
C. Being able to live and fish anywhere in Canada
D. Being able to play hockey anywhere in Canada
answer: B. Being able to live and work anywhere in Canada
explanatory_sentence: Mobility Rights - Canadians can live and work anywhere they choose in Canada, enter and leave the country freely, and apply for a passport.
